Q1: What is an expression in C?

Q1.A: A combination of operators and variables
Q1.B: A statement that ends with a semicolon

Q2: Which type of expression consists of only constant values?
Q3: What type of expression produces integer results after implementing all type conversions?
Q4: Which type of expression yields results of type bool?
Q5: Which concept deals with the evaluation order of an expression?
Q6: Which of the following expressions is an integral expression?
Q7: What does the following expression evaluate to? x > y && x < y && x == 10
Q8: Which expression represents a constant expression?
Q9: In the expression '10 + 20 * 30', which operation is performed first?
Q10: What is the purpose of operator precedence in C expressions?

Q10.A: To determine the order of arithmetic operations
Q10.B: To assign priority to variable names
Q10.C: To control the flow of program execution
Q10.D: To define the size of data types

Q11: Which operator has the highest precedence in C?
Q12: In the expression 5 + 3 * 2, what is the result according to precedence rules?
Q13: What is the precedence of the bitwise AND operator (&) compared to the logical OR operator (||)?

Q13.A: Bitwise AND operator has higher precedence
Q13.B: Logical OR operator has higher precedence
Q13.D: Precedence is not defined for these operators

Q14: Which of the following operators has the lowest precedence?
Q15: What is the result of the expression 10 / 2 * 3?
Q16: Which operator is used to override the default precedence of operators in an expression?
Q17: What is the precedence of the ternary conditional operator (?:) compared to the assignment operator (=)?

Q17.A: Ternary conditional operator has higher precedence
Q17.D: Precedence is not defined for these operators

Q18: What is the result of the expression 6 * 2 / 3?
Q19: Which of the following is true regarding the precedence of operators in C?

Q19.A: Unary operators have higher precedence than binary operators
Q19.B: Binary operators have higher precedence than unary operators
Q19.C: Precedence depends on the specific operator
Q19.D: Precedence is not defined in C

Q20: In an expression a = b + c * d, which operation will be performed first according to precedence rules

Q20.D: It depends on the values of b, c, and d

Q21: What is the result of the expression (3 + 2) * 4?
Q22: Which of the following has the highest precedence?
Q23: In an expression a = b + c * d, what operation will be performed second according to precedence rules?

Q23.D: It depends on the values of b, c, and d

Q24: What is the precedence of the increment (++) and decrement (--) operators compared to arithmetic operators (+, -,*,/)?

Q24.A: Increment and decrement operators have higher precedence
Q24.D: Precedence is not defined for these operators

Q25: What is the precedence of the bitwise shift operators (<< and >>) compared to the arithmetic operators (+, -, *, /)?

Q25.A: Bitwise shift operators have higher precedence
Q25.D: Precedence is not defined for these operators
